fields.description: As you removed the checkboxes in front of the file name in split view of the staged, there is no easy way to move one file to stage or back to unstage again. Please bring back the checkbox or (better) move the files by double click (and add the option to open a file in the context menu).
fields.summary: Fast switch for staged/unstage files missing

fields.description: In 1.8.x the tab menu was redesign and a scrollbar was added. This improvement is missing in the current beta. if you have many tabs opened it becomes really unhandy to find the right one. Please bring back the old (1.8.x) design with the ability to move the tabs.
fields.summary: Bring back tab style

fields.description:
I click the icon to open the desktop application.  The application opens and the cmd window popup opens and closes immediately.  It doesn't stay open long enough for me to read if there are any error messages or even click on the window.

If I close the application and open again, I don't see the popup window.  If I restart my computer and open the application, I get the popup window with the same behavior.  I can't login to pull/push.
fields.summary: SourceTree login popup opens and closes immediately

fields.description:
If I do something on command line and come back to SourceTree window a refresh is not triggered but I have to press F5 to refresh the repository. Refresh option is enabled but seems it does not recognize file changes.

I did a "git rebase --continue" to end a rebase which was not recognized and a "git push --force" which doesn't refresh the view. Both work in stable version.
fields.summary: Refresh not triggered

fields.description: In the current beta version the "use fixed-width font" option is moved to forth position but "Display a column guide in commit message" is still on top. As the later is activated only if the former is enabled, it is not a good option to separate both settings.
fields.summary: Wrong place of "use fixed-width font"

fields.description:
In the "File Status" > "Working Copy" view,
Selecting lines to stage, if you select from bottom to top, it mis-selects the bottom line.

i.e. if I click line 5, hold shift, click line 3. lines 3,4 and 6 will be selected (skips line 5, and selects line 6 instead)

Workaround: click line 3, hold shift, click line 5: all works as expected, lines 3,4 and 5 are now selected.
fields.summary: stage lines selecting incorrectly

fields.description:
My development tools consists of MS VisualStudio and an addon named nCrunch. This is a utility that continously runs nUnit tests. It does however create and deletes temporary files once every 1-3 seconds. 

The issue is that these files are part of the Pending files, and SourceTree notices them and enables/disables the Commit button rapidly. If I manages to click Commit, it most likely crashes SourceTree. It seems like a deadlock situation, but hard to tell. Shouldn't be hard to reproduce with nCrunch installed and running.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not handle temporary files bouncing in and out

fields.description:
It's very frustrating to constantly eyeball whether the branch exists locally and not on remote to safely know you may right click and delete it. This process can lead to a deleted critical branch not pushed remotely or code lost.

Often I will be working on potentially many local branches at one time, and using the Jira workflow, have pull requested a bunch, they stay in my local list, which I understand why, but performing the clean up of these branches is cumbersome and dangerous.

I propose a simple icon on the side of the branch to indicate if it's not found on origin, or if Fetch -> Prune branches not found on remote is meant to be used to clean up local branches for this exact problem, then it needs to be addressed as it doesn't function.

 !image-2016-07-12-14-32-18-269.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: A simple icon on the side of the branch to indicate if it's not found on origin

fields.description: After installation of Sourcetree v1.8.3 when login to Atlassian account at first, the app has been crashing.
fields.summary: Sourcetree crashes
I cant download data to Source Tree

fields.description:
Add a UI action to fetch a branch without checking it out.
Should support the following use cases (assume {{develop}} is checked out):
* Fetch from remote into local tracking branch ({{git fetch origin test:test}})
* Sync across local branches if fast-forward ({{git fetch . develop:test}})
fields.summary: Fetch without checkout

fields.description:
Calling `git show` from the terminal already shows the method signature that is associated with the displayed hunk for C# code if `*.cs diff=csharp` is set in .gitattributes

Please respect this setting in the GUI diff as well.
fields.summary: show current method signature for hunk in the diff panel

fields.description:
When you try to finish feature in WIndows version of Sourcetree there is a dialog with Gitflow for it. This dialog load all feature names and then... it hides everything even when there are some existing features so this dialog is actually unusable because you cant select which feature you want to finish. This is in production version of sourcetree and this bug still exist in beta 1.9.5

 !image-2016-07-11-14-22-46-985.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2016-07-11-14-23-49-051.png|thumbnail!
 !image-2016-07-11-14-24-25-716.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Git Flow dialog for finish feature in windows dont work

fields.description:
When you open existing repository (existing on disk) there is new GUI for add bookmark, which cannot be finished in this state - I dont believe that

 !image-2016-07-11-14-16-20-450.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Create bookmark GUI is really really ugly on Windows 10

fields.description:
The new improved tree view works very well, however is quite hard to quickly distinguish files from folders.

It would be nice if folders where written in a bold font or have any other visual hint that makes clear they are not files.
fields.summary: Make clear visual distinction between folders and files in tree view

fields.description:
To recreate:

2) Choose 'Open'

After these steps, SourceTree pops up an error dialog entitled 'Oops!' and asks me to report the bug.
Seems like this should open the Windows dialog to choose an editor program rather than crashing.

.\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\sourcetree.log says:
_ERROR [2016-07-07 12:59:49,049] [1] [SourceTree.AppRoot] [HandleCrash] - Fatal error
System.NotImplementedException: HandleGeneralTaskFailure is currently unavailable form here. ---> System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception: No application is associated with the specified file for this operation

   at SourceTree.ViewModel.Utils.CommandSinkBinding.<set_CommandSink>b__3_1(Object s, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e) in C:\projects\bitbucket.org\atlassian\sourcetreewin-prod\SourceTree.Api.UI.Wpf\ViewModel\Utils\CommandSinkBinding.cs:line 47
   at System.Windows.Input.CommandBinding.OnExecuted(Object sender, ExecutedRoutedEventArgs e)

Currently having trouble attaching sourcetree.log, getting "JIRA could not attach the file as there was a missing token. Please try attaching the file again."
fields.summary: Crashes on 'Open' operation chosen from right-click menu on a file type with no Windows file type association

fields.description:
If large files commited sourcetree display a warning message like "Following files are bigger than 10MB, Continue commit?"

But the filename of these files is missing, no matter what the name of the file is sourcetree just list "10". Real filename is not in the output window. Please find attached screenshot of message (German).

fields.description:
I added a clean repository with an SSH link. All the data can be pulled without a problem and everything seems fine.
However when I open the repo in a tab, it just closes after a certain period of time (this is under one minute).
I'm guessing this has to do with the refresh timer which used to just reset scrolling every now and then, but now it just closes the tab.

I don't know if I can provide any logging to help with this? Nothing seems to appear n the windows event log
fields.summary: Repo tab closes out of itself

fields.description:

This should be a trivial task.
How about making the text area (highlighted in yellow) editable?

fields.description:
#I committed my changes.
#My buddy pushed 2 changes.
#I pulled his changes and got a merge conflict.
#I resolved the merge conflict by "Resolve Using 'Theirs'".
#Unstaged files window is empty. (That's ok so far.)
#I added my changes inside the file manually. It was just a hunk of 30 lines!

But now I see all changes inside the Unstaged files area not just my 30 lines!!!

Even worse: There are the same changes in Staged files and Unstages files (exactly the same line additions and removals). That must be wrong!
fields.summary: Wrong diff on unstage files working on merge commit

fields.description:
1. Install Git for Windows
2. Install Sourcetree For Windows
3. Clone a repo
4. Install Git LFS
5. Modify files
6. Stage files
7. Make sure view is set to "Log/History"

Expected: Clicking on a file and scrolling the "Staged files" section will allow you to look at files/persist the view of what you looked at.

Actual: Clicking on a file will show you file details for a moment, then focus ends. Scrolling the view of "Staged files" will reset to the top within a second.
fields.summary: Sourcetree + Git LFS causes the "Staged Files" item list to reset

fields.description: The Load SSH Key? prompt that appears during install mentions a 'No' button, however the actual text of the button is 'Cancel'. It probably should be changed to 'No' as it's paired with a 'Yes' button.
fields.summary: Confusing button text on Load SSH Key? prompt during install

fields.description:
Setup:
1) Checkout a branch of a git repository with a remote that has several remote branches.
2) Under the Remotes in the tree view, right click another branch and select "Pull origin/other-branch into current branch"

Expected behavior:
The Pull dialog should select the "Remote branch to pull" as the remote branch that was right clicked.

Observed Behavior:
The Pull dialog seems to show whatever remote was last pulled from, regardless of which remote was originaly right clicked.
fields.summary: Context menu to pull into local from remote branch does not select the correct default remote branch

fields.description:
Problem:
If there are files from sub-folders above in the list, files from the root folder may display non-empty path.

Expected:
Correct path (empty) in the "Path" column for files from the root folder of the repo.

Set up:
I have few folders in the repo. I have files changed in the root and in one of the sub-folders. I switched to "File Status" or "Log / History" tab.
Sorting mode - "Pending", "File name alphabetically", "Flat list, multiple column", "Split view staging"
Important - there should be enough changed files to not be displayed on the a single list page. Scroll after update will reveal the issue.

When performing some actions, the diff and files list show information from the previous time they were displayed, rather than being empty.

In the attached screenshot there is nothing to pull or selected, yet the files list shows a file (.hgtags) and the diff view shows the diff for that file. These changes are from the previous commit.

fields.description:
https://www.virustotal.com/en/file/830353dd509be111bd37d6110478eb82a19fc82f7b076f1dc11c43bdf51fce8a/analysis/1467555837/ 

ClamAV        Win.Malware.Mischa-1        20160703 
Kaspersky Trojan-PSW.Win32.Puty.r        20160703 

The version of plink.exe is very old indeed, and isn't even digitally signed, so even if this is a false alarm (and I hope it is), then sourcetree should at least be shipping with a newer, signed version.
fields.summary: Kaspersky Antivirus claiming Plink.exe from Sourcetree Beta has trojan

kadamowski0416@KOMP0205 MINGW64 /c/repos/MLProductsCatalogConfig (master)
$ git rebase MVN_3_2_3
First, rewinding head to replay your work on top of it...
Fast-forwarded master to MVN_3_2_3.
{code}

fields.description:
When using GitFlow, Start New Feature, we encourage our developers to make the feature name:

login/feature_name

The login is the developers login name or initials or some identifier.  But they have to type that in each time.  It'd be a nice enhancement to be able to set the default new feature name textbox with some text and have the cursor appear at the end of that text when the dialog is shown.
fields.summary: Allow for a default feature name text in GitFlow - Start New Feature

fields.description:
Allow sorting bookmarks on Windows alphabetically.

It seems this was implemented on Sourcetree for Mac in SRCTREE-838 - looking for the same feature on Windows.
fields.summary: Allow sorting bookmarks on Windows alphabetically

fields.description: When trying to merge branches where there are submodules the merge appears to be completed but when I then try to do the commit SourceTree detects that the submodule is dirty and prompts you to go to it. If I hit the button to do so the tool crashes.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when doing merge/commit with changes in subrepo.
Crash When Intit of GitFLow

fields.description:
When using SourceTree with PuTTY against a Git server only accepting modern HMACs (for example {{hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com,hmac-ripemd160-etm@openssh.com,umac-128-etm@openssh.com,hmac-ripemd160,uma-128@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512,hmac-sha2-256}}) the communication fails with

{code}
We claim version: SSH-2.0-PuTTY_Local:_Apr_16_2013_12:55:41
Server version: SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_6.7p1 Debian-5+deb8u2
Using SSH protocol version 2
Doing Diffie-Hellman group exchange
Server unexpectedly closed network connection
FATAL ERROR: Server unexpectedly closed network connection
{code}

In the server log one can see:

{code}
sshd[75215]: fatal: no matching mac found: client hmac-sha1,hmac-sha1-96,hmac-md5 server umac-64-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-256-etm@openssh.com,hmac-ripemd160-etm@openssh.com,umac-128-etm@openssh.com,hmac-sha2-512,hmac-sha2-256,hmac-ripemd160,umac-128@openssh.com [preauth]
{code}

The root cause for this problem is that the plink in the SourceTree distribution is ~3 years old. Updating the included PuTTY tools (plink, pagent and puttygen) would also fix some security bugs found in PuTTY in recent years and would update puttygen to generate 2048-bit RSA keys by default.

PS: You might even consider using TortoiseGitPlink, which is patched to show host key prompts as Windows dialogs...
fields.summary: plink.exe is too old to connect to servers configured to only accept modern ciphers

fields.description:
*Problem:*
SourceTree started to use my private Atlassian registration mail address to mark commit to used git server. The behavior started without a manual configuration change.

*Checked:*
# The configured user name and mail address in global git configuration is still the currect address. The project configuration uses the switch "Use global user settings" and display the global correct value.
# I opened a long time unused project and pulled the current state from master. The log shows the switch from the configured mail address to the mail address from the license.
# I checked the windows profile APPDATA directory and the wrong used mail address is part of the sourcetree.license and accounts.json only. No other reference can be found. (Accounts.json shows mail address in user name field and mail address field is empty while the license shows correct name and mail address).

*Question:*
Is this a source tree issue? I did not find any configuration which references the wrong mail address for commits.
fields.summary: SourceTree uses registration mail address in git comments

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* Commit file that has line endings as CRLF
* Change any line in committed file
* Discard Hunk or selected lines of the change.
* Check for uncommitted changes (ensure ignore whitespace is off)
Expected result: No changes detected in file
Actual result: line endings for entire file have changed to LF only.

This behavior is not exhibited when discarding the entire file.
fields.summary: Discard Hunk/Discard Selected Lines changes CRLF to LF

fields.description:
In SourceTree 1.8.3, it has been reported that for some users Git operations can take a long time when using Embedded Git 2.6.1. This could be e.g. 40 seconds or 1 minute.

Switching to System Git (latest version) in those case seems to fix this issue.
fields.summary: Embedded Git 2.6.1 is sometimes slow in SourceTree 1.8.3
Can you add a quick search (filter) at the top of the projects pane so that we can retrieve and between many projects.

fields.description:
The lower right windows (where you can see the changes of the selected file):
the horizontal scroll bar(s) are often placed much to low to be visible. Unfortunately the cursor keys are not bound to scrolling here. 
It would be much better, to show only one horizontal scroll on the top or bottom of the window!
Instead of having a horz. scroll bar per block  of changes, a single scrollbar would simply scroll all blocks with changes within the window.
fields.summary: Scroll Bars Within Window

fields.description:
It would be very helpful to be able to open the code of a commit in a external editor.
A context menu entry in log/commit list would do it.
fields.summary: Show Code in Editor

fields.description:
A killer when the hands are both on the keyboard: some dialogs can *only* be cancelled/confirmed with the mouse. For example, when discarding a file, you get a confirmation dialog with OK and Cancel buttons. I'm sure there are others, but I'm not in a position to provide anyone a comprehensive list. I'm just reporting the problem at hand.

Anyway. The OK button should be pressed when hitting Enter, and the Cancel button should be pressed when hitting Esc. Additionally, either button should be focused, which will be pressed when hitting the spacebar. This is default Windows behaviour for confirmation dialogs, and default behaviour for most OS'es, afaik.

I'm not sure why this functionality has been stripped out, but I'd like it back please.
fields.summary: Some dialogs do not respond to Enter/Esc/Space

fields.description: Stage/Discard hunk/lines is not available when selecting a changed file. Can be fixed by staging and unstaging the whole file. Then the commands show up.
fields.summary: Stage/Discard hunk/lines is not available until stage and unstage the whole file

fields.description:
During commit the progress dialog/console output sometimes locks up and will not close.  It finally crashes with a windows exception  0xc00000fd (stackoverflow).

I'm committing to a private repo.

Unable to provide logs as it appears 1.9.3-beta-1 is not logging anything (I can only find logs for 1.9.2.1)


*Work Around*

Manually switch to the "File Status" tab rather than using the "Commit" toolbar option when you want to carry out a commit.

*Cause*

When using the "Commit" option SourceTree records the current tab, e.g. "Log", "Search", so that it can return the user there after completing the commit. After some refactoring of the commit view, to fix its location in the "File Status" tab etc, a loop was generated where the switch back to the old tab would trigger a refresh of the old view, which would finalize the previous commit, in turn refreshing the old view etc.

When manually selecting the "File Status" tab the loop is avoided because there is no 'old' tab to return to.
fields.summary: Commit progress dialog sometimes locks up

fields.description: It'd be nice if there was some option to hide tags from the log view.
fields.summary: I'd like a way to hide tags from displaying in the log view

fields.description: Please :(
fields.summary: Linux build

fields.description:
This is an intermittent bug. It happens frequently but not all the time.

When I select a branch in the branch tree pane, after a second or so the selection flips back to "File Status" i.e. the root of the branch tree.

When I right-click on a branch in the branch tree pane, I get the usual options like Merge. 
See attached screenshot 1.
When I click on merge, I get a dialog saying "Are you sure you want to merge "File Status" into your current branch?"
See attached screenshot 2.
If you click OK, the merge fails.
See attached screenshot 3.

It seems that the selection has flipped back to File Status between the right-click menu being generated, and the option being selected.

This can happen three or four times in a row until it finally allows you to merge the thing you actually selected. Same for other choices (delete, pull, rename, etc.)

When it stops doing it (i.e. starts working properly) then it usually stays working properly until the Sourcetree application is re-started.
fields.summary: Branch tree selections revert to "File Status" after right-click

fields.description: I click open on the submodule check dialog box and source tree crashes
fields.summary: Crash when clicking open on the submodule check

fields.description:
Stage a few files, then hit Commit. 
SourceTree hangs, and the blue progress bar stops moving. 
Killing SourceTree and restarting shows the commit has suceeded.

This first started failing on 1.9.3-beta 1, but still fails the same way on 1.10.0-alpha-1
I have un-installed and re-installed, to no avail.
Changing Git versions: 2.8.3, 2.8.4, 2.9.0, Embedded git  - makes no difference.
Rolling back to SourceTree 1.8.3 works fine.
fields.summary: Source tree hangs when commiting.

fields.summary: White background on commit, push, pull and fetch icons

fields.description: Merging branches gives an checkbox option to "Create a new commit even if fast-forward is possible".  This is our preferred option when merging feature branches into main branches because it preserves the fact that there was a branch created.  Doing a fast forward looks like the commit was made directly to the main branch.  This option is not available if you use the Git Flow > Finish Feature method of completing a feature, Git Flow does a fast-forward commit if possible.  Please make an option available for Git Flow > Finish Feature to be able to always create a new commit.
fields.summary: Git Flow Finish Feature needs to have a prompt for "create a new commit even if afast-forward is possible" like merge branch does

fields.description:
When I use the "Unstaged files" checkbox to stage all files, the "Staged files" view shows a loading-animation forever, no matter how many files should be staged.

The only way to get the UI refreshed is to switch to another view (e.G. "Commit" in the ribbon or switch to another project) and switch back.

After switching the view (and switch back), the loading animation is gone and the files are staged.
fields.summary: Stage all - No UI refresh

fields.description: happened during Git Fetch

fields.description:
Repository list on the left side does not have ability to sort and search repository, they are displayed in random order. Generally the working set of repositories grow to 10-20. It would be nice to either have search and sort by name for repository.

Also it would be nice to have some shortcut to open Source Tree with specific repository open.
fields.summary: Search Repository bookmarks (Repository List on the left)

fields.description:
index.lock is misused in this version.

70-80% of the times I try to do an operation (Commit/Branch/etc.) I get the error message:

fatal: Unable to create 'D:/Source/sensoria-main/.git/index.lock': File exists.

I checked the folder, and can observe the index.lock file being created and deleted several times within few seconds even if no operation is happening in Source Tree.
fields.summary: index.lock issues

fields.description:
Fresh install. Some commits made by hand and I wanted to push using source tree. But I cannot as console reads:



{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false push -v --tags origin master:master
Pushing to git@xxxxxxxx.git

The server's host key is not cached in the registry. You
have no guarantee that the server is the computer you 
think it is.
The server's rsa2 key fingerprint is:
ssh-rsa 2048 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40
If you trust this host, enter "y" to add the key to
PuTTY's cache and carry on connecting.
If you want to carry on connecting just once, without
adding the key to the cache, enter "n".
If you do not trust this host, press Return to abandon the
connection.
{code}



yet, there's no way to to "press 'Y'" here. Is there any way for sourcetree to catchis case and act more user friendly or allow adding the key w/o leaving ST?
fields.summary: Unable to continue access (i.e. push) within SourceTree with services using not cached keys

fields.description: this occurs when I try to find a file in the repository with the intention to see its log...
fields.summary: source tree crash

fields.description:
I have multiple git repos open and switching between them shows the Log / History view. That is ideal.

However, I noticed that when I scroll down and select a particular commit, then change tabs and change back, the scrollbar is at the top again. It does not preserve the previous position.
fields.summary: Switching between tabs with Log / History should preserve scrollbar

fields.description:
When a commit is cancelled, the pre-commit hook doesn't stop and runs until the end.

Besides the useless CPU comsumption, this is a problem because our pre-commit hook stashes and unstashes unstaged changes before and after running tests on the code. It manages gracefully interruptions, so that changes are finally unstaged anyway. But if we cancel the commit in sourcetree, the hook still runs, and if we make changes to the code, these changes are deleted as soon as the hook ends... SourceTree should terminate or kill the pre-commit hook when the commit is cancelled.
fields.summary: Cancelling commit doesn't terminate pre-commit hook

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user has both Git and Mercurial installed in their system, the installation process gets stuck in the "Install tools scren"

h3. Environment
SourceTree for Windows 1.8.3 -- Both Git and Mercurial are installed in the computer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install both Mercurial and Git in your system
# Do a fresh installation of SourceTree
# Duiring the set-up, there is a step "Install tools":  !Screen Shot 2016-06-21 at 15.02.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The 'Continue' button in above screen should be enabled

h3. Actual Results
The 'Continue' button in that screen is disabled if both Git and Mercurial are installed in the user's system

h3.Workaround
Select 'Skip Setup' in the above screen
fields.summary: When a user has both Git and Mercurial installed in their system, the installation process of SourceTree gets stuck in the "Install tools" screen

fields.description:
When using SourceTree for a bit, I notice that when I have multiple repositories open and I change tabs, it always shows File Status. For example, say I have 2 tabs open:

# Select a tab
# File Status is shown
# Click on Log / History to change it
# Select the other tab; File Status is shown
# Click back to the first tab; File Status shown again

If you restart the application it goes back to showing the Log / History and not jumping to File Status each time.

I saw a related bug, SRCTREEWIN-4197, but this seems different in that File Status is not randomly being selected.
fields.summary: Changing tabs always shows File Status

fields.description:
See screenshots 1, 2 and 3.

Umlauts like ä, ö or ü are set correctly during a commit. But after editing the comment with "Rebase children of", all umlauts get replaced with questions marks "?".
fields.summary: German umlauts ä ö ü are not correctly displayed after edit comment in "Rebase children of"

fields.description:
Ever since my JIRA and BitBucket account logins were joined, I cannot use SourceTree
SourceTree just crashed with the attached log file
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes after JIRA and BitBucket accounts are joined

fields.description:
When I use

{{
[http]
	sslCAInfo = <c:/path/to/FILE.pem>
}}

SourceTree works correctly.

However, if I try to add a specific per-HTTP-server setting like

git config --global http.bitbucket.sslCAInfo c:/path/to/FILE.pem

[here, our internal server is named "bitbucket"]

which results in this in ~/.gitconfig:

{{
[http "bitbucket"]
	sslCAInfo = <c:/path/to/FILE.pem>
}}

Then,
# open Clone Repository
# hit the globe to browse for a repo
# select one 
# hit OK
# the client throws an error about self-signed cert after Repository Type

Not a huge deal, but this means the CA info for _any other_ git servers I use has to be added to that pem, instead of it only applying where I want it to apply. Other git tools work fine with the more specific config.
fields.summary: sslCAInfo only works at top level http config

fields.description: Also, the tab order is wrong.
fields.summary: Discard dialog: Enter and Escape keys don't work

fields.description:
# Creating a personal repository from SourceTree hangs, but repo is created. 
# First button is no visible 
# On "Enter" TextBox with repo name is not disabled
fields.summary: Create Personal Repo hangs

fields.description:
1. Open a repository with submodules
2. Right-lick a submodule in the tree and click Change source URL...
3. Change URL

There is no new line at the end of the .gitmodules file. This may depend on which submodule was changed if there is more than one. Git itself seems to always insert a new line at the end of the file.

The result is Team City cannot check out the repository. The problem was quite hard to diagnose. It may be that other software packages expect a new line at the end of the file as well.
fields.summary: No new line at the end of .gitmodules when changing submodule URL

fields.description:
I use bookmarks to organize my repositories inside sourcetree. Sometimes when I move a repository into a existing bookmark or moving a new created bookmark around it happens that this repository/bookmark magically disappears from my bookmarklist forever, and yes, I can readd it then.

It also happens when I delete a repository from this bookmarklist and I choose the option "Delete Repositories on Disk", that sourcetree deletes all my repositories that I have in my bookmarklist from my disk.

Yesterday I deleted sourcetree and did a fresh install with sourcetree 1.8.3.0 / system git 2.9.0 and after moving a bookmark around for about 10-15 times, it happend again.

See my two videos.
fields.summary: Moving repositorys into Bookmarks make them dissapear / deletes them

fields.description:
SourceTree crashes 95% of times when I try to copy (ctrl+c) a filename from Log / History tab.

The text is saved in the clipboard, so the ctrl+c works... but then I need to restart SourceTree.

It's the box at the bottom left, with the list of files updated, below the box with the commit-comment.

Note that SourceTree gives me the option to do right-click "Copy Path to Clipboard" but it's not the same.

If the ctrl+c gives me what I need to copy
Component/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/jsp/aboutUs.jsp
the "Copy Path to Clipboard" gives me something else
C:\EclipseWS\myProject\Component\src\main\webapp\WEB-INF\jsp\aboutUs.jsp

I'm attaching the log.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when I try to copy (ctrl+c) a filename from Log / History tab

fields.description:
Amend doesn't work. ST acts as if the amend succeeded, and the log says it's succeeded, but the commit didn't actually get amended. All files that I wanted the commit to amend with, are still in staging afterwards. So effectively nothing happened.

Amending from the command line works fine.
fields.summary: Amend doesn't work

fields.description:
I suppose Commit messages are written by UTF-8.
But, When "Default text encoding" is specified for "shift_jis",  the messages are influenced it.
fields.summary: Commit messages are garbled

fields.description:
*Initial issue by the customer (v1.8.3)*

SourceTree is locking up a lot (Windows not responding error). This occurs in nearly every aspect of the application, but especially in file staging areas. My log file is littered with issues regarding missing repositories. The repositories mentioned in the log are not in the bookmarks area or the bookmarks.xml. There are also errors about inability to connect to analytics.

*Update (new beta version):*

- Initially user wasn't getting nearly as many lockups after shutting off analytics reporting, but seems like after a while the freezes have been happening again. Hence user downloaded the beta version. Result:

{quote}
Everything was alright until I added all of my bookmarks back. Every time I try to stage a file it freezes for 30+ seconds. It usually only occurs on the first file staged, but not always.
I've looked at the logs and they are clear, but that assumes that C:\Users\<User>\AppData\Local\Atlassian\SourceTree\sourcetree.log is the correct location for the logs for the beta.
{quote}
fields.summary: Frequent lockups

I've problem with ST stagging, when I checked or unchecked the file commit in this stash, It does nothing, not changging the file stage or remove it from stagging, Please fix it. Thankkssss

fields.description:
It is inconsistent, can change from project to project, seen it couple version ago, then it gone and then come back again.

1. Change some files in project
2. Check files on your "Uncommited changes" node
3. Press Commit button on toolbar (or Alt+Shift+C)

==> Files in files list for commit are unchecked (no checkboxes checked).
fields.summary: Previously checked files become unchecked after pressing Commit button

fields.description:
Working on Windows 7 64bit with following software versions:
Git for Windows 2.8.3
SourceTree 1.8.3.0

Context:

*     looking at a commit in the 'Log / History' tab
*     the commit has many changed files (~200 files)

Triggering actions:

*     click the first file in the list of changed files for that commit
*     press and hold the 'arrow down' key to go down the list of files

The last action spawns a 'git.exe' process for every file, which in turn spawn a 'git-log.exe' process.
One would expect these 'git-log.exe' processes to end or be killed by SourceTree.
Instead, these processes lose the parent/child relationship with the Git and SourceTree process and remain alive in a suspended state.
When going through the list slowly, processes end normally.

See attached screenshots for Process Explorer output.
fields.summary: Many 'git-log.exe' processes remain alive but suspended when going through the changed files of a commit

fields.description:
Adding a tag like "2016/06/EndOfSprint" allows to browse hierarchically through the tags as in a tree:
* 2016
** 06
*** EndOfSprint

This works by manually adding a tag, but not while using git-flow to "finish a release" or a "hot fix". This used to work some months ago in previous versions.
Now, when finishing a release, entering the the tag value "2016/06/EndOfSprint" will only enter a tag with the value "EndOfSprint", trimming the herachical prefix.
fields.summary: Tag hierarchically

I'm trying to create a patch from a bunch of stage files

fields.description: All Branches or Current Branch? What about a custom filter of the branches I want to see? Usually I'm trying to see what state another branch is in compared to the current branch. So I have to turn on 'All Branches' and then I see way too much. This is important because if I need to use the graphical view, it's usually because there are enough commits in the history.
fields.summary: Add custom filters for Log/History

In the Mac version, dropdown menu items (e.g. "Commit options...") can be selected by pressing the mouse button on the dropdown button and then releasing it over a menu item. 

This doesn't work in the Windows version - two clicks are required.

fields.description: Please make the command options sticky or have default options that can be set in the application settings. Examples of two settings I have to have every time I perform a merge or fetch are "Commit merge immediately (if no conflicts)" on the merge dialog and "Fetch all tags" on the fetch dialog.
